text: We are at the delicate interface between ocean and air...liquid and gas...the event horizon where molecules evaporate.  This interchange is ethereal.  Then, low frequencies rumble through depths...louder...closer, now. And the ocean surface is torn by a 46-foot catamaran and ROAR of 2,700 horsepower, rocketing at us at 140 knots...
in PROFILE.
...has a canopy, low like a B-1 bomber and extends a half mile.  It launches off two-foot swells, goes airborne, pu to 150 knots with another 1,100 RPM left...
pilots the "Born to Win" in full helmet.  On the throttle flaps is RICARDO TUBBS...

leads the frontrunners towards a finish line demarcated b couple of $10 million yachts loaded with media.  At the l moment occurs a small power loss, and "Born to Win" gets nosed into second place by the 46-foot Skater, "Goddess".

thunders to the dock, throttled down at low revs.  The ca is up.  Crockett and Tubbs' helmets are off.  Dockhands t it off.  It's the same crowd you catch at a Grand Prix: figure money, tall, Northern Italian women and minor Germ princesses with Swiss educations, no bimbos and no questi about asset origins.  The exception is "Born to Win's" sponsor, a blonde, dreadlocked, bearded 6'4" SWITEK.  He looks like a dot-com entrepreneur who got out in time.  N to him is a blonde Ukranian lady with high cheekbones.  W see her again.
in second position to the Japanese driver and throttle ma "Goddess," neither of whom speak English.  The #3 boat, "Bicardi Silver," was driven by David Scott and throttled John Tomlinson...
leave the winning circle among Asian and Mexican billionaires.  As the small crowd breaks up...
named NICHOLAS in Vuarnet wraparounds and buzz-cut white glides by...
(low)
Burnett, what's crackin'?
Nothing.
Maxin' and relaxin'.
(doesn't believe them)

Sure.  Change your mind; get inclined?  Let me know... Whatever Nicholas is soliciting, Crockett and Tubbs don't want.  (Nicholas brokers "go-fast" runs, moving loads fro offshore into South Florida.  Among guys who pilot offsho race boats, there are one or two who've never run a load, no one's found them yet.)  Meanwhile...

A couple-hundred-thousand-dollars worth of granite and st Off-screen a restaurant-grade Sub-Zero opens with a hiss. Fan starts.  Beyond the kitchen we SEE through a dining r to a den.  A chair is overturned.  We HEAR muffled sounds We SEE feet extend through a door jamb.  Someone's on the floor.  A television is playing, distantly.

so close they almost come to life.  A Venezuelan family, boys and a girl in a pool.  Maria, Alonzo, the two boys a their sister's baptism.  And we see holding the baby daug is Riccardo Tubbs. A family dinner at a South American restaurant.  Tubbs si with the youngest daughter on his lap.  Maria is on the o side of him.  This is the image that almost comes to life We hear the vivacious latin ambience late on a Sunday afternoon when families take the grandparents and have dinner.

Th image morphs into a naked woman presenting her rear to a muscled biker next to a chopper above a swastika residing between shoulder blades.  SS lightning bolts are on his n PULL BACK from this MAN, who is bent into the frig becaus he's hungry.  His head is shaved and he's naked from the waist up.  A BLACK HEFTY GARBAGE BAG is tied around his waist.  Yellow industrial gloves are on his hands.  Somet bad is happening in this house...
It's a Sikorski skimming across the water of Biscayne Bay a moonlit night at living-room level past stilt houses.
pilots the chopper past the brightly lit windows of high- Collins Avenue condos for the fugitive rich...and heads towards the MacArthur Causeway.
What's our deal?
Backup in case the Russians get physical.
How lucky's Miss Universe gotta be?
Skin has to touch skin.  That's the requirement for the warrant.  Then he makes a credible excuse and he                         stops.... (beat)

Her crew blackmailed and asset- stripped the last mark down to his social security...                                        In the back - her long copper legs stretched out under a short skirt - is GINA CALABRESE.
This I gotta see... (beat)
...the "make up an excuse and stop" part.
Have faith.
I have faith.  In horoscopes and fortune cookies...
So?

Switek pulling this off...?  That's not faith; that's delusional... Wearing enough of nothing to hide the micro .380, which G checks right now.  There's a round in the chamber. AERIAL:  THE SIKORSKI crosses past the stacks of $5 milli condos to a landing pad on a roof.  The Miami of the '80' that twilight-zone frontier built on coke-fueled cash flo is over.  The frontier development stage is passed.  It h BECOME Casablanca.  Anything goes; everything has a price

Crockett, Tubbs and Gina descend to the 25th-floor pentho the target.  As Crockett and Tubbs continue down to 24, s looks over her shoulder at Tubbs...
Damn, girl...

location: SURVEILLANCE APARTMENT, (ONE FLOOR BELOW THE TARGET)

text: enter.  Two surveillance technicians, RICK and FRANK, are glued to a monitor showing a bedroom in which nothing happens.  LT. CASTILLO is there, out of a past somewhere between CIA and the Jesuits... Referring to the monitor on which there are NO PEOPLE in EMPTY BEDROOM. They are watching air move.
This is exciting...
That's 'cause nothing is happening.
No shit...?
(it goes past him)
Yeah.  This is their surveillance...how they video their marks?  See, we jacked their fiber optics, like we piggybacked their signal.  Get it?
Cooool... They exit to...
are met at the door by security, who recognizes them, and welcomed by their host, UGO.  This is the Baccardi Cup Af Party.  The same players from the marina...
enter an 8,000-square-foot penthouse...offshore racer typ players, So Bee models...
Runnin' the Biscayne 200? Crockett wanders off...
If a coupla new exhaust manifolds show up...
approaches a bar and female bartender...
Gin and Tonic.  Plymouth or Boodles.
(Scandinavian accent)
Lemon or lime?
Lemon doesn't go in Gin and Tonics, darlin'.  Where ya' from?
(leaning in)
Gottingen.  That's in Sweden.
You in Miami workin' on your complexion...? She's beautifully bronzed.
(laughs)
No.  I was in Namibia...
Doing...?
With the United Nations High Commission on Refugees.  Famine relief. Gina's listening on her personal comms.
Really?  I did refugee relocation in Somalia.  But they transferred me out after I was wounded... Gina rolls her eyes as she crosses by Tubbs.
Only African he ever "relocated" was a $2,000-an-hour Nigerian model for Gucci, and he got wounded when she took an NBA draft choice to the Super Bowl instead of him...
He did volunteer one time...
(entering)
For a massage parlor bust? (beat)

Why am I here...? TRUDY JOPLIN is a tall African-American.  She whispers in small mic.  If you looked closely, she's ripped...as if s cables moved under her smooth skin.  She slides past Tubb and Gina...
(low)
...to backup Switek.  But only if it gets lethal.
That's impossible.
Why?
Because you cannot kill him.

all white bling, is arguing with his blade-thin, glassy-e adrenaline junkie partner, ZITO.  Approaching is "Miss Ukraine."  High cheekbones suggest one of Genghis Khan's horsemen found her maternal ancestor as attractive as Swi finds her... Tubbs clocks three beefy Russians in a corner, one is unusually fit.
And there's Dmitri...
The honey trap.  And there's the honey.
Hello, Miss Ukraine... MISS UKRAINE brings Switek his glass of champagne...  She whispers something in his ear...and is led towards a back bedroom.  Gina ambles over.
(to Crockett)
Eleven to seven he blows it.
(whispers)
Twenty on my man...
You're giving away your money, fool... Tubbs opens his Moto as if he's about to make a call...Tr looks over his shoulder.  What we see is the feed from th monitor in the surveillance room downstairs.
Two blonde people starting to get naked.  Switek and Miss Ukraine.  A second call comes in.  Tubbs ignores it.
(to Zito)
You bet your partner?
Sure.  Switek versus primal impulse from the amygdala.  Higher thinking versus the lizard brain.  Tectonic plates of libido confront the cognitive.
Oh, bullshit.  She cops his joint. He pushes the button.
What's so fucking difficult? THEIR FACES.  They watch.  And...Crockett's cell phone ri He separates from the group...
Yeah...?
Sonny...?
Yeah.
Where's Riccardo?
On the phone.
I'm sorry.  I'm sorry, Sonny...
enters.  He's come outside to hear better. In the background Gina shakes her head about Switek.  He it.  Trudy looks at Crockett and sees Crockett's focused, hearing...
Who is this?
He's cruising at 85.  He's floating in a magnolia leather interior.  But it's bloodstained from his nose and mouth. He's been beaten.  His white shirt is torn.  He doesn't care...
(voice cracks)
It's fucked up.  I'm sorry...
(recognizing him)
Alonzo? (beat)
What are you talking about?  Where are you...?
They had me from the gate.
I don't understand... Crockett's alarmed.  He catches Tubbs' eye and waves him outside...
I gave up nothing on you guys. Don't worry.  I kept you and Rico out of it.  Only the Feds.  They're on their own...it's all their deal, anyway, so fuck 'em.
Alonzo, what's goin' on?!
After I check on Francine and the boys, then I'm gone.  Sonny, tell Rico I'm so sorry.  I wanted you to know... Tubbs joins Crockett on the balcony.
Where are you?
...look after her.  Ask Rico to. Okay?  Do that for me.  I had to do it.  They had me from the gate. Do that.  Whatever you can do for them.  Okay? (breaks)
Look what I did to them, Sonny...!
Alonzo...!
Goodbye. Crockett's phone goes dead.
What is it?
Alonzo...
Stevens?
(nods)
Something's wrong. Crockett's entering a number while...
(dialing)
I'll try Francine... Meanwhile Crockett HEARS...
(recording)
Federal Bureau of Investigation. Our office hours are... (Crockett punches three- digit code)
(cuts him off)
This is Detective Crockett.  Miami- Dade P.D.  Patch me through to your Special Agent in Charge, James Fujima?  It's an emergency...
He'll be in on Monday...
I said, "emergency."  If he's not reachable, who's running the weekend?  The ASAC?
We don't give that out...
Listen carefully. Crockett compels himself to be patient.  Meanwhile, Tubbs struck out with Alonzo's home phone. CROCKETT (cont'd) (into Nextel)

An informant who is working one of YOUR cases right now called me. YOU may have a problem.  So get me somebody on the other end of this telephone who knows what the hell I'm talking about...! Meanwhile...
(into phone)
C'mon...
Miami-Dade PD Tech...
(into phone)
Bobby G.  The firefly we used to have on Alonzo Stevens' Bentley, check if it still runs; if so, launch Air Support.  Locate the Bentley... (pause, listens)
I don't know...we haven't worked with him for six months...
(waits, then hears a click on his Nextel)
Hello?
This is Agent James Fujima.
Detective Crockett.
What's your Miami PD badge number?
(pause)
Okay.  What's up?

A C.I. we cut loose to your Joint Interagency Task Force.  Name of Alonzo Stevens.  Now, he's YOUR informant.  Stevens, called us.  I haven't spoken to him for six months. I do not know what case you have him on.  I do not know what he is talking about.  But whatever he is doing for you, it sounds like it is going bad.  Right now...
How do I discuss operations over an open line?
How do I know? (beat)
I got the call from Alonzo on an open line.  That is the hand we have been dealt at this moment, at eleven-forty-seven o'clock Friday night.  Okay?  I am trying to alert you, here. (beat)
You know whether or not...you have a thing goin' down.  I do not. (beat)

But we know this guy.  I think you know this guy.  Normally, he is cool.  Tonight he is distraught. That is atypical.  That engenders foreboding.  Do you understand the meaning of the word "foreboding"? As in badness is happening to your deal right fucking now?
Nothing.  Rusting marine parts and corrugated metal fall weeds next on a channel of the Indian River.  It cuts thr inner-city Miami.  Distant noise.  But...

in low light are strapping up.  Kevlar vests go over tatt arms and chests.  Glimpses of swastikas.  Handguns in waistbands.  SMGs (Small Machine Guns) slung from shoulde over white shirts, business-suit jackets.  Everybody wear surgical gloves.  Shoes are industrial.
are leaving.  One carries a very long rifle with a flash suppressor.  It is a bolt action .50 caliber Burrows.
is a second Aryan Brother sniper team with an identical weapon aimed at an empty lot a thousand yards away across Indian River...
Two Suburbans and an Escalade pull out...

Caribbean freighters seized by US Customs rust at the ban MOVE IN.  Two Cadillacs are parked.  Waiting.  A door ope An interior light comes on.  MOVE CLOSER.  Two Russian slickster types.  Patient.  One looks at a watch.  The ot triggers his cell phone.  A meeting is imminent.
Empty except for the FBI Agent in a sweatsuit carrying fi as if he stopped by when Crockett's call came in.  He's o computer.  He picks up the phone...
Guy's involved in a "meet"...
"Buy and walk"?  "Buy and bust"? "Reverse undercover"?  What?
Meet and greet.  "I flash you some of mine, you flash me some of yours?"
And the deal goes down at another place at another time.
That's right.
...so there's no industrial- strength HRT weapons team out there tonight? Crockett puts his Nextel on "speaker" so Tubbs can hear,
Correct.  Flash samples.  Flash cash.
(into phone)
Haitian, Dominican, Russian, Israeli?

(sarcastic)

He is saying they had him from the gate.  He is saying to my partner and I and to his family "goodbye." What does that tell you?
in the back seat get lucky.  The pilot reacts as the TECHNICIAN in the copilot seat has picked up a signal fro the FIREFLY...the LOCATOR...on Alonzo's Bentley.

...sample now is okay.  And we want sample load when we do deal...

Ice.  Spectra-analyze that shit. And party-on with the coke.  You are looking at ninety-two percent pure...none of that jumped-on powder they sell up in New Yorioo...
Yeah... (beat)
Now, let's see the green... One of the Russians puts his hand on a weapon as the othe opens up a Nike sports bag.

Okay.  You got lotsa green.  We got all the goodies.  We party. Larry'll call you in the AM and talk money, quantity, time and place... WIDEN.  Everybody goes back to their cars.  As the two "Russians" get into theirs, Aryan Brother #1 turns from t running board of the Escalade with his driver's door open
Hey, Ivan!  I forgot to ask you something, my brother... He looks at his partner and nods, who says something into Nextel. ARYAN BROTHER (cont'd)

...they have a decent death-benefit program in the FBI? For the Russians in the car, time freezes.  As they start to react, they're blown up by .50 caliber rounds from the sniper positions.  The .50 caliber rounds go right throug car bodies, sheet metal, upholstery, glass, human flesh, bone, more upholstery and metal and out the other end. Another round goes through the passenger door, through th passenger, through the driver, out the driver door and in the night...

The three Aryan Brothers approach the steaming cars with chopped-up occupants and take the gym bag full of cash. Escalade driver dons night-vision goggles.  They load up drive off as we hear the "thump, thump" of Air Support an some distant sirens.  Meanwhile...

at 170 knots watching a thermographic image of Alonzo Stevens' car on a monitor weave through traffic northboun the 95...  SEE Tubbs' Sikorsky beyond Switek + Zito as it swoops from a higher altitude right past the Miami-Dade chopper, banks and dives for the freeway.
Tracking with Stevens' Bentley from the front. The black Sikorsky is almost on the Bentley's hood.  Tubb racks the chopper sideways so that Alonzo can see Crocket the copilot seat...

has his handgun out and is waving Alonzo over to the shoulder.  Tubbs keeps the chopper almost blocking Alonzo Bentley.  Alonzo pulls over.  Tubbs wheels around and lan on the shoulder.  They approach...
exits the Bentley and walks toward Crockett and Tubbs.  H holds his hand out to keep them at a distance. Freeway traffic roars past.  Crockett and Tubbs don't get close, heeding Alonzo's warning...
(incensed, over traffic noise)
What the hell did you do?

The Feeb gig was I front a coupla undercover, Russian-speakers to them.  One's ATF.  And broker the deal.  Set up the meet with the NLR types... Stevens takes a low-resolution E-mailed image from his po and hands it to Tubbs.  Tubbs looks up, shocked, hands it Crockett.  Stevens' head rotates loosely on his shoulders...his mind's elsewhere...

Alonzo's wife, Francine, is bound - clothes torn - to a c in a TV room.  On the floor are two young boys bound with plastic ties.  Paper bags are over their heads.  Francine eyes are as large as saucers.  Around her neck is a neckl of C-4 explosive connected to a detonator. STEVENS (cont'd) (shouts)
So I gave them up, man!  Gave up the Feds!  Gave up everything I knew.  Now I got to go home...
How'd they get onto you?
How do I know?  But it was from the get-go.  Knew the FBI had run me into them. (beat)
Sonny, I gotta go...!

and a Miami PD SWAT team crash through the front door. Another team through the back.  Trudy in a tactical vest second in with a 12-gauge.  The house is empty.  Gina and other detectives hang in the rear.  First SWAT team "clea the living room, dining room.  Second clears the kitchen, maid's quarters...

...last room to clear...center of the house.  SWAT teams appear around corners.  Weapons up.  The looks on their f tell us nobody is here...nobody alive...and what they see gives even these veterans pause as blood pools around the legs of a family and overturned chairs.  Alonzo didn't sa anyone.
(after changing channel)
Hello, Sonny...?
on police radio listens to a message from Trudy while...
(to Tubbs)
I gotta, I gotta go...!
Alonzo...
What...?
(voice cracks)
Alonzo, you don't need to go home. Now Alonzo knows.
They said they wouldn't hurt them, wouldn't hurt them if...
They lied.

They been known to do that... Alonzo Stevens has a strange look in his eyes.  He looks Crockett and Tubbs, as if to say something.  He doesn't. Crockett and Tubbs walk towards him, to reach him...to console him...
backs away.  Looks at them sadly.  And before they can st him, he steps out onto the freeway, opens his arms, and embraces the front bumper of a 70 m.p.h. 18-wheeler.

Grim, silent, race through Miami traffic to the crime sce we know is ahead because... OVER TUBBS' SHOULDER we see all the lights from two dozen emergency vehicles a quarter mile ahead.  Death is not procedural or casual, not when it's somebody you know, li an informant you worked cases with.  Cell phone rings.
Yeah.
What's your twenty?
Quarter mile away.  We see the lights...
Turn around.
(taking cell)
We know these people...!
Grieve elsewhere.
in a concrete space.  We've entered mid-scene.
We're not certain...
You said Nazi Low-riders...?
We're not certain!
C'mon, man!
We think NLR.  We don't know! Alonzo only fronted as a broker for our guys to make the meet.  He wasn't deep into the crew.
White gangs...?  It doesn't track.
White gangs is tweakers and a crystal meth lab in a trailer park. Bounce around the old lady Saturday night and get your recidivist ass busted back...

Not anymore.  This is a distribution network out of South Florida, moving poly-drug loads, crystal meth through coke, to Nashville, Atlanta, Memphis, Cleveland.  And computer fraud, identity theft. It's like that.
(to the point)
Tell them what you want.
They knew about Alonzo, before he made a move on them.  They had our operation.  They've cut into us.
How?
We don't know.
Break your encryption?  Hack your e- mail?  Employee databases? Somebody on the inside?

We don't know.  And that's the point.  Maybe there's a mole. Whatever, it's a disaster.  And         it's a Joint Interagency Task Force.  I have DEA, ATF, U.S. Customs components in on it.  So the penetration could be from any one agency.  What we do know is I have to suspend operations right now from undercover work through interdictions 'cause I have to assume our Operational Security is blown.
As in, your ass is dead in the water.
But Miami PD wasn't part of the J.I.T.  And from what Alonzo said, he didn't give you up.
So what do you want?
To recruit you. Pause.
...I didn't want you around the crime scene because it's crawling with federal law enforcement.  We don't know who's straight up, who's not...
Recruit us to do what?
Get into business with this crew, identify them.  Illuminate their network.  If you're lucky, discover their source, how they penetrated us.  We'll indict and take it from there...
How do we do that?  Make a buy? (wry)
That went well...
Reverse undercover?  WE supply to them?
They got a steady stream of supply. So, no...
From whom...?
A Colombian producer.  Named Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.
Never heard of him.
From the North Valle area.  New. Low-level, we think.
Aryan brothers are not going to change-up suppliers.  So...
Transpo?  How they bringing the loads in...?

They're not.  They collect in Miami.  Montoya, the producer, handles deliveries.  That's his end, and he varies the routes.  We got some FLIR off an AWAC of a coupla go-fast boats, on one run, that's all. Fujima boots up his military-spec laptop to view the FLIR video.  Meanwhile...
Track with me, here... (beat)
They knew the "Russians" were undercover Feeb?  They should have no-showed.  But, no, these guys show anyway, and commit murder upon federal officers.  And steal all your money... (beat; to Fujima)
What does that say to you?
(speculating)
It says, "We do not fear you." (to Fujima)
It says, "Fuck off and die."  It says, "We get down for recreation..." Fujima's Dell laptop glows to life.  Two almost indistinguishable boats and their wakes are SEEN. CROCKETT (cont'd)
Blow that up... Crockett's attention goes to something atypical he spots about the wake emerging behind each boat.  He exchanges a look with Tubbs.  But they say nothing.
(to Crockett)
So?
We could try to run loads into these guys. (to Fujima)
Run a few loads for Montoya into South Florida.  Into this group.
You need to consider a few issues.
(to Crockett + Tubbs)

...you'd be operating outside territorial United States.  Your         badges do not count.  You have no         authorization to carry weapons.  If you're busted, it could take a long time to get you re-patriated.  And         there's no backup...         (to Fujima)
And you will share with them all         your intel on Montoya...
Sure.
I mean full disclosure.
Of course.  From my side, I don't         WANT to know anything about what you're doing or how you do it... (to Castillo)
So let me know if we're on... Fujima splits.  Castillo waits until Fujima's car pulls a
(to Tubbs)
About the Stevens family, I'm sorry.  I know you were close to them.
I was the kids' godfather.
(intuits)
And...?
"And" what?
I got to know.  There is never any room for "personal"...
(for Tubbs)
He is fine.  And we know the jokes. When it gets vengeful, things get         messy.  When they get messy the wrong people die... (beat)
Everybody gets it.
Good.
And the answer is "yes." (beat)
Before she met Alonzo, once upon a time, a long time ago. (beat)
You bet it was personal. ...and is now compartmentalized in the past.
Okay. (to Crockett)
What'd you spot...?
Three wakes off the back of those boats.  Who runs three Sterling engines off a deep-V hull?
Sal Maguda.
He any good?
Oh, yeah...
So what's gonna persuade Montoya to         change off Sal Maguda running his         deliveries...? It's a rhetorical question.

and a SWAT team in the weeds across the river.  They incl SGT. JEAN-LOUIS BASTIDE, a Haitian in dark sweats.  They are in plain clothes.

react, but Crockett draws down on one with an AK-47.  Bas wounds the second GUARD who had drawn down his H & K.  A Third Guard begs to live in French Patois.  They own the place.  And Crockett sees... 800 individually-wrapped bricks of North Valle Colombian cocaine are on a table.

Suburban crashes through the wreckage of the door and bac to the table.  Jean-Louis and SWAT #1 start throwing bric into the back.  Tubbs with Crockett exit.
approach the two deep V-hull go-fast boats with three eng off the back.  Tubbs cracks the breech of the grenade launcher and loads a 40-millimeter shell, while he stroll down the dock...
tosses two Willie Peters (white phosphorus grenades) into boats.  Tubbs fires the M-40 at a third boat, which explo flame, followed by...

destroy the smuggler's Strykers, which we saw in Fujima's video.  Crockett + Tubbs have just put Sal Maguda out of business.  They walk away and around the side of the shed disregarding the curious citizens of Little Haiti, come t watch the fireworks...
