location: LA PERLA DISTRICT OF SAN JUAN, PUERTO RICO

text: Corrosion and decay.  People look coldly at us.  Malevole and malefaction on every corner.  No one's picked up the garbage for a month.  Poverty in the Caribbean half-light
cross the street to CAMERA from their rental car.  The La Perla section was a 16th Century haven for pirates.  It's little civic improvements in 400 years. They enter a nightclub - shabby neon.
There are no customers.  They're cautious.  Men stop them and frisk them.  They expected that.
We're from Nicholas to meet Jose... They're waved to the rear.  They start towards a back tab A small group of people wait...

He's a former right-wing Colombian paramilitary from the North Valle near the Pacific coast.  He runs operations, communications and security.  He has cold eyes and a corp face.  He's notorious for using torture to ferret-out informants.  Right now he watches these two Americans approach.  Security people are on either side of him.
(extends hand)
Jose...
Sonny Burnett...this is my partner, Rico.

Sit. As Crockett sits, he notices that at a table a few to the side is a woman.  This is ISABELLA.  Behind glasses, she seems immobile, filled with intelligence, well-dressed in subdued Tom Ford and staring at him.  Reading him.  Crock holds the look that extra beat and turns back to business
(to Security)
Dos cafe. He's security, not a fucking waiter.  But Yero nods. Security fetches coffee, anyway.
So lay it out, my brother...
Nicholas said you okay.  That's nice.  But how I know if you any         good?
What...?
Who you run loads for?  Cause other         than Nicholas, you knows you? Tubbs looks at Crockett.  They thought it was a done deal
(dark)
My mommy and daddy know me. Isabella tilts her head imperceptibly.
And we didn't come down here to         audition.  Business auditions for         us... (beat)
...and know who we are and know         they want their load run by us         before Nicholas calls.
That way we do not waste AvGas or our motherfucking time. Yero's security reacts to the tone and raises weapons.  A start up out of their chair as...

appear at the door, SMGs from shoulder straps.  Zito flip D14 hand grenade which Crockett snatches out of the air, pulls the pin and slams on the table.  Everyone FREEZES. Only Crockett's hand pressure restrains the clip. CROCKETT (cont'd) (goes right up in Yero's face)

You want to "know" shit?  Who the         fuck are you?  You got a side deal         with U.S. Customs to open up the         coast in a few spots...in exchange you flip them some gringo runners? Like us...?
You wearing a wire?         Tubbs rips open Yero's shirt.

Or DEA?  The Feeb?         Yero's shirt...open to the waist.  No wire.  Yero's furio Yero's people have weapons pointed their way.  They outnu Switek and Zito.  Slack's taken up on triggers.  It's on edge.  And the edge is overloaded.  Tubbs reads that, war Yero...
People gonna walk into this place and say, "Ola, hijo!  That some         crazy wallpaper.  Whew...it wild!         Is that a Jackson Pollack?"
"No, viejo.  That was Jose Yero, splattered all over his motherfucking wall."
So we can close each other's eyes right now.  Real easy.  Real fast. (pause)

But, then, nobody makes any money...         Yero gestures his security to calm down....one notch. Crockett and Tubbs still hold the grenades. Then Crockett opens his shirt.  No wires.  So does Tubbs. Pause.
(flat)
Equipment?
Slow and low, Adam A-500s... (Yero looks quizzical)

...carbon composite, stealthy, 1400 nautical-mile range, thousand ki payload...all the way to Caravels and 727's from a source country to a transshipment point.  Small freighters.  We've done containers...
And specialize in very fast go-fast boats for coastal runs.
What kind of weight?
We don't talk weight.  We talk logistics. Isabella sits, watching this.  She drinks her coffee. JOSE YERO (cont'd)
You get longs and lats for the pickup.  Open ocean.  You run it in.  On shore, our people receive the loads.
(interrupts)

The people on shore who handle a load we run are our people, not your         people.  No tweakers, dopers, first-         timers we don't know.  They didn't do time with us, they ain't doing crime with us.

What you get from us is a date.  A place.  "In the parking lot of a Jack-in-the-Box in north Miami."  At such-and-such time, an eighteen-         wheeler will be there.  Keys in the ignition.  Ready to roll.  You pick         it up.  And you drive it... (waves his left hand)
...away.
Money thing is done in advance in         places where there are no guns. Because when money and guns get         together, there is violence...
You afraid of violence?
I am not John Wayne.  There is no         "S" on his chest.  We get down if         the play calls for it.  But we are into business and making money.
And violence is extra.  And expensive.  So how much weight you looking to move?
Nothing.  'Cause how you do         delivery on the beach, I don't like.  Maybe this does not work.
Then it don't work.
What happened to the last transporter you had?
What do you care?
(to Crockett)
Do we need this...?
(rises)
Red light, green light, Jose?
(doesn't answer, leans back)

I'm also called "Cochi Loco."  That means "Crazy pig."  'Cause I enforce security and get people to         tell me what I need to know.  That         part of what I do, you never want         to find out about. (pause)
Other people will negotiate the         money and go or not go.  Not me...
Then what were we talking to you for?
I had to lay eyes on you.
And...? Isabella watches Crockett...
(to Tubbs)
You seem okay. (to Tubbs re: Crockett)
But him?  I don't like... how he         looks... Everything goes from tense to lethal.  Has Yero made them
What do I care what you think about how he looks?  You wanna fuck my         partner or do business?
Wait by the phone. (pause)

You get a call.  Or maybe you don't.  Until then, piss off back to where you come from... Crockett flips the hand grenade and catches it with his l hand...and he drops it in front of Jose Yero.  It spins o the table.  He had reinserted the pin.  And they back out

Contemplative.  Offscreen a door opens.  Entering is Gina Calabrese.  She's naked.  She washes his back.  She dumps much shampoo on his head.  He tries to clear it from his eyes.  Laughs.  They start to make love under the water, the steam, through the misted glass, offscreen we hear an engine rumble...
Somebody's coming.
...Sonny can wait. Tubbs and Gina are not random lovers, they're in love.  T look in her eyes, the openness is pure femininity behind Bronx presentation.  She smiles, touches the side of his face.

location: SAFE HOUSE, ON THE INDIAN RIVER

text: ties up a 75' Sun Seeker.  It looks like a 38' deep-V offshore racer on growth hormones.  Crockett's alone, as fades over the '60's ranch house on the river.  It's unde tropical trees, with one strip of white neon utility ligh outlining the flat eave.
let himself in.  He's at a kitchen stool at the counter w Tubbs enters in sweats.
Anything?
Nothing. Gina enters in a robe...
(beat)
"Hi, Gina.  Hi, Sonny."
Hi, Gina. (putting shopping bag on table)
This is from Frick and Frack. Trudy?
(re:  bag)
What do we got? Crockett pulls out three overly-large cell phones...
Satellite.  New encryption. Supposedly sharper than the G... (to Gina)
How good's our background? Tubbs and Crockett look at the Mac screen as Gina boots i up.  Gina's fingers tap dance on the keyboard.
You're so not the PD, if you got busted on a DUI, you're in serious trouble...you're bad men back to grammar school. (to Tubbs)
San Quentin.  Pelican Bay. (to Crockett)
Marine Corps.  Statesville. Pelican Bay, where you guys hooked up.  Now you're too smart and too fast to get jacked again...
How will it stand up?

If they ran the rental car or lease on this place...even if it's EPIC database in El Paso...they'd have to work through the layers of bullshit three weeks deep.  Then they'd find your deeper, hidden criminal selves...
No one's watching it.
asleep.  Tubbs' eyes are wide open, staring...
lights up.  Beeps.  Crockett's hand grabs it.  It's the summons from Jose Yero.
(Lazily)
What am I supposed to do after I get my nails and hair done...?
Reality TV and stay by the phone.         That's what all wives-in-crime do... He leans over and kisses her.  She holds firmly the back his neck and looks into his eyes.
Be...careful...  You hear me? He winks at her in assurance and he's gone.  Her lazy smi drops off.  "Careful"...she's not so sure he will be...

Crockett in the copilot seat.  Switek and Zito are in the back, barely awake.  Zito hands out coffee.  Switek's stashing weapons behind the fuselage upholstery.  Tubbs i clearing US air space as we...
rockets through cumulonimbus against a black sky up to 35 feet.
Where we meeting 'em...?
Port-Au-Prince.
touches down, drives towards us...  Turns towards commerc aviation facility...
opens.  Switek and Zito emerge to rental cars with two ca rental clerks waiting...
Crockett and Tubbs make a careful entry.  Hands on weapon carrying bags...
What do we got?

Five minutes... We see TRADECRAFT.  They clear the room.  They check for and external surveillance.  They pull curtains.  Tubbs fr bag pulls a scanner.  Under the two beds.  Behind the picture.  The lamp.  The telephone.  Meanwhile...

"traps" the room to reveal if it had been searched while were gone.  He aligns the suitcase perfectly parallel on bench.  A matchstick goes against the closed closet door. ballpoint pen is leaned against the telephone. TUBBS (cont'd)

...show time. From his bag Tubbs pulls a Smith & Wesson J-frame hammerl in .357 Magnum.  He holsters this on his ankle.  A Reming 780 shotgun with pistol grip, sawed-off to a 12-inch barr gets slung on a bungee-cord shoulder strap under his righ arm.  .9mm under his shirt in his waistband and two spare magazines clipped to his belt.
loads a .45 "race" gun with rounded sights and a magna-po barrel, cross-drawn, and a blunt .45 Para-Ordnance in the small of his back.  They're ready.
opens.  Crockett "traps" that door, too, with a small pie of tape.

All of it tells us that where they are and where they're going is a high wire act without a net.  No backup.  Thei badges don't work.  There is no law; there is no order. are in a state of nature where people get killed for thei shoes.
wait.  Shadows on white limestone monuments.  Bird songs.
They wait.  And wait.  And nothing happens.
They watching us watching them watching us waiting for them?  Or what?
Who knows... Still apprehensive, concluding they're victims of a "no- show"...
That's it. They split.
approach their door.  Crockett stops.  The tape "trap" is torn.  Weapons appear in their hands.  Someone's been her
enter stealthily.  Then, they relax.  They need not have bothered being so careful about detecting a clandestine surveillance.
The room is overtly destroyed.  Not one piece of furnitur unbroken.  Walls have been opened.  Pictures ripped. Curtains.  Their stuff's strewn all over.  And, then...
in.  HAITIAN PARAMILITARY in soccer jerseys and shorts wi assault rifles...

AK's are aimed at Crockett and Tubbs' heads.  Crockett's and his Para-Ordnance are in each hand.  Tubbs' shotgun i aimed at the front door, his .9mm at the men streaming in windows.  Frozen moment.  A woman's voice...
(to Crockett)
Put your guns on the table... (enters, sits)
If we wanted you dead, you would no longer be drawing breath in Miami. We wouldn't have brought you all the way here.
Really?  So, what is this, a party? Crockett + Tubbs put down their weapons.

We'll have room service wipe up the furniture...and bring drinks. Isabella says something in French.  The Cops ease-up. Isabella's personal security frisks Crockett + Tubbs and remain.  Paramilitary leave.
Glad we came.  This place is a lot of fun if you're Doctors Without Borders.  So...? Isabella takes off her glasses.  She's Afro-Cuban.
I run down the numbers.  Nothing is very negotiable.  Small loads?  We pay three thousand a ki. We pay your fuel costs up front plus ten percent.  The next ten percent on U.S. landfall.
Define small.
Two, three thousand a ki. Two thousand ki's, your end is $6,000,000. (beat)
Complex transshipments or dealing with containers, these have front- loaded costs we pickup. (beat)
For this kind of weight, the balance of 80% is when our buyer picks up the load. (beat)
Transactions are offshore.  Dollars or euros.  Secure internet transfers.  We have lists of Cayman and Isle of Man banks infiltrated by IRS, to be avoided... (beat)
No transactions of cash or other banking instruments take place on U.S. soil... (beat)
That's the deal.
I thought we had to meet the Man.
You do.
When?
Right now. As she leaves...
in the back seat on a rural road.  Isabella is not with t One of her Russians is.  In the front seat, his SMG is re his eyes never leave Crockett and Tubbs.
A military Hummer in the front carries Isabella with her security.  Behind is a crew cab with bench seats loaded w Haitian paramilitary.
They approach a town.  He nudges Crockett.  A police roadblock's ahead.
has seen something else.  He indicates the pager on his waist.
That's what's surprising.  Tubbs pulls his cell phone. Meanwhile, they're slowing down for the police roadblock. Crockett gets tense...
watches.  His cell's SIGNAL STRENGTH INDICATOR steps down zero.
stop the caravan.  Is this turning bad?
alarmed.
check under the vehicles with mirrors.  See all the weapo Salute.  Usher the convoy past.
exchange a look.  Then they get it.  The cops work as security for the narcotrafficker.  The caravan advances towards a major intersection.  This one is blocked-off by Haitian military.
is snatched open.  Haitian soldiers search Crockett and Tubbs.  They defer to the Russian-speaking security. Mercedes pulls forward...
eyes his pager; Tubbs his cell phone: no signal in an urb area?  Blocking signal traffic is something the CIA does Baghdad.  It's not supposed to be happening in Haiti on a dope deal.
SEE a third circle of security approach.
carrying automatic weapons, some more casually dressed, s with night-vision goggles.  The vehicles stop.

Crockett and Tubbs are directed to get out.  They're push around and searched.  A working class Glaswegion Scot, a couple of 5'10" Brits are off to the side with short hair shoulders that are too deep and faces like Rugby players SAS).  Russians are ex-KGB.  Languages overheard:  smatte of Russian, Hebrew and English.  Crockett and Tubbs look each other:  they get it.  This is the cream of private sector security.  And it says top dollar infrastructure.
Four avenues lead in.  Each avenue is blocked.  The squar closed down to vehicles and pedestrians.  Locals have disappeared.  In the center of the square are FOUR MATCHI BLACK SUBURBANS.
gestures to Tubbs to look up.  They see...
with night-vision goggles...
are clean.
cross through a no-man's land.  It feels like being in th open in Kosovo.
checks out the first Suburban's uplink satellite dish on hydraulic mast.  The rear's converted into computer equip sitting in ruggedized racks...

Doors open.  The interior has been converted into a luxurious, limo-like office with swivel seats.  Isabella followed by Crockett and Tubbs enter.  It's occupied by ARCHANGEL DE JESUS MONTOYA-LONDONO.  He's not flashy.  He smooth skin, slightly opalescent, black eyes.  His right is normal length, but shriveled.
Please take that seat on the side...
Thank you.
(polite, friendly)
Excuse me because I am very busy and have many things to do, so this will be brief.  Yes? (beat; not waiting)
We will try you on a "run."  One. To build trust.  We do a thousand kis.  In all matters, when you work for us, you must do exactly what you say you will do. (beat)
In this business with me, if you say you will do a thing, you must do exactly that thing. (beat)
Then?  You will prosper beyond your dreams and you can live in Miami in millionaire style. (beat)

If you are arrested, there will be lawyers made available to you in the United States.  You will use them.  Anything you need, you will be provided by me.  It cost you nothing.  You will contact and work through Jose Yero on logistics and communications.  To do with money, you will work through my wife, Isabella... Crockett notices that Montoya lightly holds her hand.  It confident.  And he sees the slight smile on Isabella's fa as she watches he and Tubbs... MONTOYA (cont'd)

More than I, in finance and business, she is very dangerous.  I look forward to our doing work together.  Whether we do or not, it is unlikely we will meet again.  So I extend my best wishes to your families... (to Tubbs)
Particularly to your beautiful wife. (beat)
Thank you for making this long trip to see me... Dismissed, they exit.
Subterranean alarms are going off.  Tubbs finds himself i this small city, occupied by narcotraffickers and their security in the middle of nowhere.  Urgency agitates Tubb He controls it...
in the town square, now, too.  But Isabella stayed inside Montoya's Suburban.  Now, she lowers her window.
break up.  Montoya's Suburbans pull out.  The security co deforms.  It all disappears around them.  It leaves only Mercedes, a driver, and Crockett and Tubbs...
looks after the caravan.
in the side-view mirror on the passenger side.  She is looking at him.
holds that look.
holds his.
Sound deadens.  His attention is on the woman in the mirror...until it's broken by Tubbs' attention to his cel phone.
Signal strength returns.  Tubbs punches in numbers.
(low)
...who did we just meet? He waits.  A phone rings.  It's picked up by Gina.
Hello...? Tubbs is relieved...
You okay?
Yeah.
You sure?
Yes.  What's up?
Nothing.  Calling to say hi... What's up with you?
Bored. To Tubbs, that's good news.
Okay...see you soon.
...and thanks for the flowers.
What flowers?
The bouquet, here.  Five-hundred dollars worth of roses...yellow. Pause.
There a note? Pause.
You mean with the flowers...?
What's it say?
"Salutations from the south..." A deep chill. GINA (cont'd)

I...I thought it was from you. And, now, she gets it.  Gina is in the kitchen.  Alone, i their secret safe-house location.  She and Tubbs have not to say.  He looks to Crockett.  The message from Montoya- Londono is clear:  I know you.  I can reach out and locat you our yours.  Anytime.  YOU ARE NOT SAFE.
We're on our way...
(forced casual)
So why don't you...meet the plane... We sense this is code.  It means get the fuck out of ther right now!
(cool)
Okay.
Good idea. (beat)
We'll grab a bite. Gina ends the call, drops to the floor to the wall, kills lights, holds her Sig .9mm at her side as she moves deepe into the interior...

location: CUBAN CAFE ON CALLE OCHO, MIAMI

text: Close on their two faces.  He's holding her hand under th table.  The noise of the surrounding crowd is a ROAR.  Th the idea.  They want their words buried under noise...
discreetly at the door, watching the street.  Trudy, Swit and Zito are at adjacent tables.
...the lease, the phones, the cars...layers of false ident. Would take the FBI weeks.  How long did it take them?  Three hours? Four? (re:  the note)
This means, "We can reach out and touch somebody."  Like Bad Teleflora.
(cuts in)
...even if they could run the identities you built to EPIC, all they'll find is more cover... Trust what you built.  It's quality, girl.  We're cool...
(leans in; holds his hand tighter)
...you are trying to reassure me because you know when people get anxious, they make mistakes. You're worried about me.  Do not be. (into his eyes)

I am careful.  I am cool.  I got Trudy, backup, whatever.  You worry about you.  Because you are the ones who are in denied territory, not me.  If your focus is on me, you'll miss something coming at you.  That's how people slip up. Get hurt.  And I'd die if anything happened.  You worry about you. You and Sonny...are in the dangerous place.  I'm fine... Gina leans back in her chair.  Their eyes still connect across the distance between them.  Their hands still touc GINA (cont'd) (loud)
Fuck 'em.  They sent us some flowers.  Big deal.  Thanks for the flowers... Gina Calabrese shrugs.  Tubbs laughs, and we are...

Low music.  Dark shadows.  Half-light washes the walls fr passing headlights.  Tubbs are Gina are naked.  It's the lovemaking of a man and a woman when they hold precious t moments they have because they know that in these moments they are safe.  And that the present is fleeting.  And th know their time together is about luck.  Because life is short.  Departure is imminent.  Nothing lives forever.  I in their faces and their eyes...

A lantern lights his face.  The night is soft.  Crockett' with a couple of campesinos, playing poker and drinking b Whoever's shack this is, is a Tupac Shakur freak.  His im is on all the walls.  A diesel truck starts and pulls awa outside.

checking the cargo tie-downs inside an A-500 Adam aircraf He's sweating.  His shirt's off.  The cargo is ten black plastic-wrapped and taped bundles.  Like any good pilot, Tubbs trusts nobody but himself to tie-down the load.  Th rear seats are removed.  There's a plastic bladder holdin reserve of 50 gallons of AvGas.

wins.  The girls shriek.  Crockett pushes the money towar the Campesinos.  They refuse.  Crockett insists.  One wil only accept the money if Crockett accepts his Randall hun knife.  He does.  Tubbs is in the doorway.
We set. Crockett kisses the girls, gracious about the gift.  Tubb looks out into the night.
To the limit.
You worried about the tree line, US Customs AWACS, or something else on your mind?
Like...?
Gina in the Miami pad. (no answer)
You gonna give me phony denials?
No. (beat)
You gonna give me phony reassurances?
No.

Good.  So let's go... They head toward the strange-looking plane.  It's a singl fuselage with two propellers...one at the nose, one at th tail.  Off the wings are two booms that connect to a rear wing.  It's a Burt Rutan aircraft design. There is neither metal nor exposed exhausts for radar or to spot.  It does 200 knots at 22,000 feet.  It'll fly, forever, 1,000 kilos of flake worth $23 million, and the total air weight is less than two Bentleys.  It's the smuggler's dream airplane.
heads for the tree-line.  It will not make it.  At the la moment, Tubbs pulls back the stick and the plane lofts ov the trees, clipping the tops...
throws a look sideways at Tubbs.
airborne over the Caribbean, heading north...
(into radio)
Transglobal Airlines flight zero- zero-zero...is in the air...
Roger that.

is dozing.  A signal. Tubbs points up and to the right.  Crockett wakes, looks. Aero Commander Turbo Twin is paralleling the A-500's cour Now, it slides over them...almost into a collision.  It s right over the A-500, separated by only 75 feet.
handling a myriad of flights, reacts.  On his radar he se next to the image of the Aero Commander, a ghost image...
Eleven-ten, Sierra, do you have a visual on another aircraft...?
Switek is flying and looks down at the A-500 below...
Negative, Opa-Locka.
keys his radio.
Opa-Locka Air Traffic Control to JIT 0-seven-six-Nellie-Charlie...
Hello, Opa-Locka.  What's up?
I've got an Aero Commander coming in on a two-seventy-nine heading, but I had a double image...like there's another plane there, now I'm only picking up on one.  What do you read?

Let me see... His FLIR (Forward Looking Infrared) picks up Switek and Zito's Air Commander.  He flips through all the different modalities of detection, including thermography, for anyt else suspicious in the airspace...
(into mic)
Too many Mai Tais at lunch... You're seeing double.  One blip. One plane.

head_text.subj: TOP OF THE A-500 RIGHT BELOW IT

text: We get the joke.  The A-500 with its stealthiness under t Aero Commander together like a single footprint.

piggybacked, enter US airspace and cross the coastline in Florida. From underneath, the Aero Commander sweeps to the right o approach as Tubbs radically dives for the trees, hugging contour at 220 knots at 150 feet...having snuck this plan and its load into the United States of America.
Alone in the acid-yellow glare of the sodium vapor lights We wait.  We don't know why we're here.
MOVE IN...and we REVEAL staked-out are Crockett, Jean-Lou and Tubbs...
Neptune gonna show? We don't know who he's talking about.
Oh, he'll show.  This is his kind of deal.  Crime on crime.  Who's gonna call the cops?
(skeptical)
Usually his thing is street dealers.  Torture their families until they cough up the stash. This...?
He's ambitious.
Heads up...
Lights off.  Cruises through the parking lot past the U-H It to the other side and disappears. TUBBS (cont'd)
That's slick:  Neptune's Escalade's worth more than the real estate. But no one's supposed to notice his drive-by?
Here's another incognito genius...

cruises the other end of the parking lot.  The Escalade returns.  All's clear.  Both converge around the U-Haul-I truck.  Out of the Escalade steps NEPTUNE - 6'4", narrow- shouldered and bald.  From the Malibu and back of the Escalade, Four more Haitian ZO POUNDERS with handguns, shotguns and shades...
pops the lock on the U-Haul-It with a crowbar.  He rolls the door expecting millions worth of cocaine.  Instead he comes face to face with the barrel of a 12-gauge...
April Fool, motherfucker. Trudy whips the butt end of the shotgun around, caving in Neptune's cheekbone and nose...

goes down for the count.  Switek - under the truck - roll out.  Crockett, Tubbs with shotguns, Jean-Louis and Zito CAR-15s emerge from the perimeter with bright lights on shouting for the Haitians to freeze...
(Patois)
Arrete!  Arrete!  Freeze! (to one)
Et vous, mo-fo! A 250-lb. ZO POUNDER brings up his weapon.  Crockett BLOW the guy's legs out from under him.  Zito disarms him.  Th other two are disarmed.
is rolled over by Crockett.  He plastic-ties his wrists a feet.  Others are manhandled...
(in French)
Get the fuck in the truck...! Zo Pounders, plastic-tied, are thrown into the truck with thousand kilos of cocaine.  But not Neptune.  The gate is rolled down and padlocked.
staring at his satellite cell.  Waiting.  He looks out th window at the passing river.  Soft voices from another room...probably Tubbs and Gina.  It's five in the morning It rings.  He answers.
Client got delivery.  But there were..."extras" in the back of the truck.
"Extras" tried to relieve us of your weight... (beat)
And by the by, you know of a player in Overtown who goes by the name of "Things Aquatic"?
I do.  We don't do business with him...
He tried to..."do business"...with you.  Around ten.  His place.  Be there.
I'll be there.

location: JOSE YERO IN A TINTED EXCURSION -

text: cruises storefront churches, chacouteries, Baptist missio Haitian restaurants and palm trees.  Men in dark trousers white shirts lean in doorways.  The SUV preceding Yero st three houses before us.  The Excursion with Yero stops tw houses beyond.  Security - very casually - deploys.  NOW, Yero approaches...seen through the curtains of the window we're looking through.  Reveal Tubbs watching. And, he crosses to the door and opens it as Yero cautious enters.
And his face registers surprise.
Look familiar?
Carefully stacked in the living room are the PLASTIC-WRAP

head_text.subj: BRICKS OF COCAINE THAT CROCKETT AND TUBBS STOLE FROM SAL
MAGUDA'S WAREHOUSE WHEN THEY BLEW UP HIS BOATS.

text: Hog-tied and bleeding all over his clothes, in the corner Neptune.  His mouth is taped.  He's shaking his head...disclaiming, disowning and disavowing...
This the load you lost a while back?
It is.  He try to take tonight's load?
Yeah.
And what do I do with him?
(shrugs)

Whatever you want.  Like we said, we're not into violence. Yero looks around the corner and sees Switek and Zito in dining room, casually at ease with Galil assault rifles...meaning "don't even think about it"...

The empty mansion is on its own peninsula.  Through the windows we see a yacht and Crockett's 48' Stryker, its ca open but without its racing supergraphics.  The mansion interior...all Beaumaniers limestone...is devoid of all furnishing.  They sit on white plastic garden chairs from Sears.
(suspicious)
I walk into Neptune's house...very nice.  But I also see you... and our drugs that got ripped from Maguda.
You don't like us finding your load?  We can go and lose it all over again...
How 'bout this?  How'd Neptune know where to hit us?  Huh?  Whose Op sec's got a leak?  Yours?
What'd Neptune tell you?
He didn't.  Interrogation's not in our skill set. (beat)
So c'mon, what suspicions have you master-minded off these associations?
(whispers in Spanish to Isabella)
Here's what this is...ask how much they want to turn back to us our load... Yero's certain about their motive.
We want it back.
Okay.
What's the recovery?  How much are you looking for?
(to Crockett)
How much we looking for?
Nothing.
What's "nothing"?
Nothing.  As in "free, gratis."
And as an investment in the future...
(takes off her glasses and looks at Crockett)
"Future" of...?
A fine...business...relationship... She holds Crockett's look...as she did before.
It's yours cause what's yours, is yours.  And what's ours is ours... (to Yero)
...like the second ten-percent, which is now due, Yero, my ace. Isabella gestures.  Yero kicks across the floor a cardboa box full of money.  Tubbs glances inside.  Doesn't count TUBBS (cont'd)
What's up next?  Or is this a one- time deal? Isabella decides.
(to Yero)
Give them the shipment on the seventeenth... Yero doesn't like it.  She gestures "do it."
Conveyance?
Maritime.  Jose will fill you in. And she starts to leave...and sensing Crockett's gotten u and follows her.  Meanwhile
(to Yero)
Lay it out... And Crockett, close behind Isabella, now...
(low)
There is one thing you can do for me in recognition of the death- defying risks we took to recover your product...
(low)
And what is that? This is the wife of narcotrafficker Archangel de Jesus Montoya-Londono.
Let me buy you a drink. Isabella pauses.  Crockett may get killed right now.  The near the open doors to the patio.
(low)
What do you like to drink?
(low)
I'm a fiend for mojitas. Isabella looks over at Crockett's boat.  Back to Crockett
(low)
How fast does that go?
It goes very fast.
Show me...? Isabella and Crockett head outside towards the dock, Tubb overtakes...
Can I talk to you for a second, partner...? They step aside. TUBBS (cont'd) (low, re:  Isabella)
Wha's up...?
(low)
I know what I'm doing. And he leaves to help Isabella board.  Switek unties and pushes off the boat.  Looking out the window at them is J Yero, as perplexed as Tubbs, who covers...

...secure satellite comms. encrypted e-mail, the longs and lats for the transshipment point...all that?  It's all cool. But I need a vector, not a location.  'Cause ships move. That's why they call them ships. Ship stops?  It's trying to be an apartment building.  At sea that attracts attention.  That's bad... Meanwhile...

pulling away from the docks at 12 knots, repressing the thunder of the 2,700-horsepower engines.  Crockett leaves canopy slid back.  They're open to the air.  He gives Isabella headsets so they can talk over the roar.  The wi starts to move her hair.  She's not sure how to put on th headset. Crockett lets the boat rock over the swells while he arra her headset around her ears.  His fingers brush her hair, touch her skin... It was not intentional.  But the look in Crockett's eyes as if a small voltage passed through him. He plugs her headset into the dash, regains the wheel, sh the throttles forward and...
cuts and then leaps over swells.  In seven seconds they'r doing over 70 knots.  And Crockett holds it there as...
The wind whips her hair behind her, now.  The two are sma against the smooth 50' long hull.  Crockett hands her wraparound shades for her eyes.  She doesn't want them...
(through headset)
So where's the best place for mojitas?
Bodeguita del Medio.  It's the only place for mojitas...
Where's that?
Off a little alley with cobblestones.  Hemingway went there...
The Keys?
Havana.
Havana?  Cubans don't like us or my business...
Are you afraid? (smiles; Crockett shakes his head "no")
Good.  And you don't need a visa. Cause you're with me.

rockets from one swell to the next, getting airborne.  Wi and salt electrify Isabella.  She turns to Crockett and smiles, putting on the glasses, now.  Crockett gestures t her knees.  She should keep them bent.  Crockett pushes i 75 knots...

in strong light, ripped by wind.  Behind them are ocean a sky and twenty-foot plumes which jet from the props and m a wake that vectors in diagonals to what each is leaving behind them...where they've been...and converge to push t to the new places where they're headed.  Behind, the skie are leaden.  They're racing a storm.  Sunlight shafts thr a gap in thunderclouds, turning the clouds yellow.  Now, turn peach against the darkening open water and the grey behind.  The boat vibrates, the engines scream and...

waves her over to join him behind the wheel.  He holds ou his left hand to steady her.  He brings her to him.  Both lean against his high upholstered chair.  He holds her to side.  Indicates the wheel...
Light touch.  Everything comes to you through the wheel.

stays on the throttle, throttling back when the props are of the water so you don't redline the engine and forward when reentering.  The swells are now four feet.  They lau off each, get airborne, cut into the next... CROCKETT (cont'd)
How do we get into Cuba?!
My cousin is the harbor master. You must not bring in drugs.  You cannot be armed.  If you're carrying, it has to go.  Or stow it inside.  No one will go near your boat...
You do business in Cuba with your husband?
I never do business in Cuba. (beat)
And nobody goes to Cuba but me. (smiles)
And he is not my husband... Crockett's surprised.  And he doesn't push it.
Were you born in Havana?
Angola.  My mother was being a surgeon there.  She volunteered. Mozambique and Mali, too... (over the wind)
...those days, in those days...she was part of Cuba's gift to the third world.  She came from a bourgeois family with a house in Verdado...we still have the house. We will go there...
Where's she now?
She's dead... Crockett looks at her.  Her perspective is that of the '6 and '70's, the politics of national liberation, the perspective of Marcuse and Franz Fanon.
Your father?
Angolan Military.  Went back to the fighting.  Disappeared.  Who knows...? Isabella looks at the look on Crockett's face. ISABELLA (cont'd)
Go ahead and ask...
How's he not your husband?

I am no one's wife.  I live in my own house.  I do not live in a man's house.  He has a wife.  We are together.  I am free.  Because of banking and finance and travel... (looks at him, shouts over wind)

And I can do anything I want... She laughs.  She has that combination of intellect, beaut and youth.  Everything is possible...life will never end...she can ride this crest eternally. And Crockett knows that her confidence makes her obliviou peril, makes "right now" too real because she believes sh will live forever.

can't help it.  He looks right at her.  She lifts her fac the spray.  Some clouds part and light strikes her... And Crockett wants to possess her; to protect her.  He wa no one else to have her.  He wants no harm to come to her And this is an impulse that takes him over to the core of he is.  And, as we MOVE IN CLOSER, Crockett has to turn away...
sees this.  She's quizzical.  Crockett looks back at her. Their eyes connect.
leaps...
his left arm around her shoulder, his right on the wheel. She rocks back against his body.  They rip across the sea

location: A HAVANA NIGHTCLUB JAMMED WITH PEOPLE

text: 14-piece Afro-Cuban band.  IN THE PRESS OF dancers at a s table, Crockett and Isabella...
(shouts over noise)
Mojitas...?
(shouting back)
Later!  Do you dance?
I dance... They move into the crowd under two-story high windows overlooking Meyer Lansky's Hotel Riviera - freeze-dried 1 Las Vegas.

Whatever we knew about Sonny Crockett, we did not know he could dance.  Their feet, their knees and thighs, perfect matched, they samba, like lightning. He swings her around and turns her to a close embrace as their hips and legs parallel each other's, as he turns he under his arm, stops her, pulls her backwards into his bo her hips into his, the fast beat, the footwork, and he sp her back facing him, pressing her closer as it gets faste and...

fall onto a bed, shedding the last of their clothes, maki love in a house somewhere.  Beyond them is an open window the ocean.  The sky turns red and grey but the water stay molten. Their eyes are open...because they're locked together the whole time and their faces are steady and urgently surpri because this is not language; not a symbol, not a representation of a thing.  Jesus Montoya is not here.  M is not here.  This is discovery.  This is fact.  They hav discovered each other and have never felt like this about anyone before in their lives.

His eyes open.  He wakes up.  Light and situation flood i He does not know where he is.  He pulls on his pants. Barefoot, he walks to the window.  The interior is high- ceilinged with immaculately polished floors.  And Crocket looks around, a stranger in a stranger place.
enters.  The paint on the outside of this house is peelin and patinaed with stain.  The yard is overgrown.  The stu fence around the streamline deco facade is crumbling from weather and time...

from the balcony of the futuristic villa in Verdado...  A futurism from 1939, peeling aqua, aging science fiction. Wherever we are in the world, this place is out of the stream, outside history.  And Isabella, this woman from a different world, enters, brings him an oversized cup of coffee.  In his trousers, Crockett drapes an arm across h shoulders and they stand in the air.
hears voices from the interior.
My aunt.  She's ancient.  She looks after the place... (beat)
This was my mother's family's home...

in the funky yellow restaurant drinking mojitas.  They've lunch served to them at the bar.  Frosted glasses have su on the bottom and are loaded with crushed Cuban herbs.  T bartender has been there for 40 years.  Crockett and Isab look like regulars.  They've served chicken and plantains Like any restaurant, the people eating at the bar are the regulars.  They sit where Hemingway sat in the slow part the afternoon.
Tell me everything.
No.
I insist.
(flip)
Okay. (beat)

Macon, Georgia is where I was born. Wound up in a juvenile facility.  I was 14.  Then the military.  Then prison.  Because I was dumb and angry.  Then I read.  Then I got smart.  Then I discovered what I know, now...it's all business... Isabella smiles. CROCKETT (cont'd) (to Bartender)
My friend, two more. (beat)
What was your mother's name...?
Blanca...a rubio like you. (pause)

I see her in a dress...an old photograph from Lucinda somebody's wedding...everybody is with couples.  Husbands and wives.  They all pose.  My mother is alone because my father had to go back to the fighting. (she points)
...she looks right into the camera. She is the most beautiful woman in the room.  By herself.  In a party dress.  And she looked like she knew she would die alone... (beat...remembers)

She spoke many languages.  We were in Luanda when she died.  I went to her friends in Mali.  They sent me to the Ecole Polytechnique in Geneva to study mathematics, where I met Montoya in the discos.  He had banking there...I was seventeen and very much into the clubs.  And he sent me to University for an MBA in Finance. (pause)
Your mother?
Died in childbirth, having me...
To mothers.  And all that we owe them... Isabella looks at Crockett and smiles and puts on her sunglasses.
You know how improbable this is...?
"Probable"...applies to an event that may be real.  Doesn't apply here.
...'cause we have no future...are of today and not tomorrow.
(laughs)
That's right.
...and therafore there is no consequence?

Exactly. Crockett's hand is around her waist and slips down her hi he pulls her closer and takes off her glasses and she put down her drink and kisses him at the bar and Crockett's e dwell on her and she looks back at him and, now, knowing he's thinking...

The water is like sheet metal as clouds allow only a sliv of light to illuminate the sea while rain greys-out most it.  Minute crimson is a freighter heading to the stone harbor.  Fabric billows in the wind.  PULL BACK into the to Crockett and Isabella...

...one light skinned, the other brown, intertwine in the opiated moments after sensuality.  The afternoon half-lig drapes parts of their bodies, making a relief against whi their eyes hold each other's...

focused elsewhere.  It's as if he's struggling to record event of her in memory so she'll sustain there, because h compels himself to a different place, now.  Then, the sho curtain parts.  It startles him...
enters.  She touches his back.  He turns to her with a sm
(soft)
Let's talk deliveries. Isabella is not let down by the switch to commerce.  She merely goes there, too.  After all, this is their subject Soft smiles. CROCKETT (cont'd)
...and a different kind of deal.
Like...?
Like "three thousand a ki?"  That's nice. And I can supply the transportation into South Florida and the Gulf, more reliable and on-time than FedEx.  But, three per ki was OK for openers.
And why should continuing excellence cost more?
Cost less.  That's the point.
Is it December?
What do you mean?
Did Christmas come early this year...?
Better than that. (beat)

We become partners.  Only in this territory and only on loads we run. And you don't pay us three thousand a ki.  You pay us zero.  Why we get is thirty percent of the load. Product or cash.  "And why," you're thinking, "would I be crazy enough to out in these gringos like that? Is he chipping?  Crazy for my love? Too many mojitas?"  And the answer is, "of course" but also "no.  It is because Sonny can deliver what no one else can."
Good samba dancing...?
Zero risk.
'Cause you don't lose loads?
'Cause we guarantee every load. (beat)
Anywhere, for any reason, it comes up short, we make good.  Your operations will, from now on, run risk-free.
And you're our thirty-percent partner? Her knowing smile speaks of experience beyond her years. ISABELLA (cont'd) (deadly seriously)
What if I tell you that your ideas are too big for your skin? (beat)
That merely to propose this is a dangerous thing?
Then I would say to you, this has been fun... There's a long pause.  This is business.  This is what is
The range should be between fifteen and seventeen-point-five percent of the P.O.E....to even consider it.
I need thirty.  Calculate in, also, the cash you don't have to front...
Available cash is not an issue for us...
Twenty-eight-point-five.
What if I pushed to twenty-one...?
I would say you're... (hesitates; holds up four fingers)
...four percentage points away from a deal...
Maybe I'm only one. And she slides into his arms.  And smiles...
We'll do it at twenty-two... Isabella laughs.  She kisses him under the shower water. it's tough to know who is pushing it further out onto the edge. CROCKETT (cont'd)
...and now what?
And now I make you breakfast again... Her breathing is heavier as she buries her head in his ne
Crockett is alone.  Black skies mottled with grey.
Rain and wind rip across his face.  He left Isabella in Havana.
rings.  Crockett picks it up.  It's Tubbs...
Where the hell are you, man?
(into phone)

On my way back... Crockett disconnects.  He pushes it.  It launches from on swell, airborne, and knifes into the next.  It's violent. Crockett's thoughts and expression are about Isabella.  T are criminal conspirators, a woman cheating on her narcotrafficker "husband," an outlaw smuggler who's reall undercover cop...
rockets in and then throttles back.

sitting on the U-shaped jetty as we HEAR Crockett kill th engines, tying it off.  Gina stands halfway up the small to the early 60's ranch house under tropical palms.  Tubb mood is dark.  As Crockett approaches, he looks blankly a Tubbs, offering no explanation...
(mutters)
The meet with Castillo and the fed got set up.  It's in 45 minutes... Tubbs goes inside.  Crockett follows.  As he passes Gina.
What's up, Sonny...? Crockett looks at her.  He has no answer.
enters.  While Tubbs is strapping up...
Where'd you go?
Hit a couple of jazz clubs.  Fell back to her place.
Where?
Verdado.
Verdado where?
It's in the suburbs outside Havana.
Havana, Cuba...?
No.  Havana, Louisiana. (beat)
Don't we have a meet?
...where you're makin' a move on the wife of Archangel de Jesus Montoya?
No.
You're not makin' a move on her...?
We're makin' moves on each other.
Oh, that makes it okay, then.

location: ENGINE ROOM OF A TRAMP FREIGHTER SEIZED BY US CUSTOM

head_text.subj: AND TIED-UP ON THE INDIAN RIVER

text: We've entered a secret meeting mid-argument.
Who said, "go exploring"?  We want this staying on track.
(to Fujima)
Who's the "we"?  There's you and there's us.  And all we got from you was bad intel.  "Low-level producer."  Yeah, right...
What are you talking about?
Montoya.  We went to meet the village priest.  It turns into Alice in the fucking Vatican and here's the Pope...of the North Valle Colombia dope trade.

His operations are kingpin size and first-class.  His security is ex- Eastern bloc, ex-SAS and Israelis. Their comms are satellite uplink with mainframe encryption, significant Sig Int and in their zones of activity, they have signal- jamming capability... Fujima is surprised...
Yeah.  CIA-level stuff...
And what does that level of spending on first-class, private- sector infrastructure signify to you?
Mega-tonnage and mega-cash flow...
Out of...?
Haiti and Puerto Rico.  Money through Dubai and Geneva maybe.
Their loads are poly-drug.  "E" from Holland, methamphetamine precursors from Jordan, Afghan "H." Mid-ocean transshipments.  His real business is:  he's a network.
And we can illuminate part of it from the inside out.
So we want to change-up the mission statement.
(no)
Identify and indict the white supremacist group of importers. End of story.  Everything else I'm  hearing is speculation masquerading as intel... Crockett flips him a set of keys. FUJIMA (cont'd)
What's this?
Keys to the boat.  Go do this motherfucker yourself. Fujima looks at Castillo...who is this insubordinate pric
Who are you talking to?
He's talking to you, bro. (beat)
What he means to say is he is reluctant to abandon the penetration of a major narcotrafficking organization...
(re: Fujima)
Hey, fuck him.
Chill out Sonny.
We're the ones doing the death- defying shit?  And he wants us to give that up?  For what? A chump-change bust so he can get his picture in The Miami Herald to impress the slug farm in DC...
(to Castillo)
Control your men.
I'm my own man.  And anytime you         want to see how much man I am?
(low)
That's.  It. Everybody shuts up. CASTILLO (cont'd) (to Tubbs)
Where are you on this? We know Tubbs has doubts about Crockett's motives and methods, nevertheless...
With Sonny.  110%.
Then that's it. (to Fujima)
Change the mission statement. Crockett stays in.  He keeps working up the ladder.  The local importers get a pass for the time being.
I don't know.
Yes you do...
I got to talk to my ADO...
No, you don't, Jim. (beat)

'Cause if I close this down, you got nothing to make a phone call about.  And my guys don't have a week for a Feeb bureaucratic process.  Every hour longer they're in there, they risk exposure.  So, right here, right now, they're back in or I pull them out and close you down.  What's it going to be? Fujima nods acquiescence.
Okay. He leaves.  When he's out of earshot...
(to Crockett)
You fuckin' better be right...!
step across to a second ship among the dozens tied-up alo the river.  Its crimson paint is peeling and it's been stripped of everything salvageable.  They're alone.
(low)
What is going on...?!
As in...?
There is "undercover."  And there is "Which way is up?"
You think I am in so deep I forgot?
I am asking.  You to me.
Do you believe...I have forgotten I am a cop?
I would never doubt you. This is the answer Crockett needed to hear. TUBBS (cont'd)
And do you doubt I will slot anyone complicit in the death of Maria, Alonzo and those children? Anyone...whoever they are...
No, I do not. And we know that might mean Isabella.

We are on a peninsula with palm trees.  A bluff dotted wi small forest of satellite dishes.  A ribbon of white-sand beyond that is silver light off the water.  It is rural a futuristic at the same time.
...90- and 120-day futures with shorted Canadian and US dollars...

in pajama top and boxer shorts, smoking a cigar.  In a sweatsuit is Isabella, delivering a financial report.  It from memory.  Nothing is written down, in the tradition o the elite section of Swiss private banking in which clerk commit portfolios to memory.  There are no documents.
...and we're looking at Nigerian crude...
Precursor shipments from Ras Tanura and Ju'aymah?
Transshipped to a Malaysian container ship.
Not French registry?
They've been targeted.  And Pakistani registry is too vulnerable to search and seizure right now.
Jose doesn't like the deal in South Florida... Montoya's referring to Crockett.  Alarm bells go off.
(cuts in)
Burnett? (shrugs)
They want 22% of the value on loads they run into South Florida.  It's the Juarez cartel model. They guarantee the loads.  The upside is our risk goes to zero. That frees-up capital.
But what does your intuition tell you...? Is he suspicious?  Does he suspect Isabella and Crockett lovers?
My "intuition"...?  My intuition made him breakfast the other morning in Havana. Her lieson with Crockett is the last thing we expected to hear from Isabella.
And...?

They're serious.  They're cautious. They'll forgo a deal over a technicality of how a delivery's handled...they'd walk away, rather than compromise operational security...that's good. Montoya's thoughtful. ISABELLA (cont'd)
But they have to be watched closely...
Why?

A good deal, like this with us, for Burnett will be good only temporarily.  He'll get restless because he believes nothing is forever.  Life is dust, make it while you can.  He's ambitious. Montoya appreciates her thoughtfulness. ISABELLA (cont'd)
So I predict a few good runs.  Then there'll be a renegotiation.
That's my girl... Montoya uses Isabella and her sexual allure to gather ins into the people he does business with.  That's part of th deal. MONTOYA (cont'd)
On the next load, Jose wants to front them silver.  But they them in lead... (beat)
He thinks they are wrong.  What do you think?
(revealing nothing)
I think Jose suspects anybody he doesn't intimidate.  And people, who are good at what they do?  They have egos, too...
(careful)
What would you do...?
(equally careful)

I like the diminished risk.  It frees up capital reserves.  I like working with self-interested businessmen who are competent.  You can predict their behavior.... Montoya looks at her very carefully.  She stares right ba at him. ISABELLA (cont'd)

On the other hand...if what you wish, mi corazon, is la plumba...the lead?  Then let's do that.  Accept their deal.  After the load is received...we will close their eyes forever... She looks at Montoya squarely.  It hangs in the air.  In strange process of decision-making, Montoya reaches a conclusion...

Let's try a few runs with these partners, I think.  I will tell Jose... If Isabella is pleased, she doesn't show it.  Montoya continues to stare at her unwavering expression, frozen i stone.  He smiles, then, and starts to take off her cloth He reaches for her hand and brings her to him.  She kisse him and he puts aside his cigar, pulls her face into his neck, and she runs her hands down him...
lands.  The door opens.  Isabella emerges.  CLOSER...she searches, looking for someone as she descends the ramp. Then...
emerges from behind an SUV.  He came to meet her plane.

expression changes, but she masks it. Businesslike, she walks across the tarmac.  There are two Suburbans.  One for her; one full of security.  Crockett her meet.  No show of affection.  Her Secretary, carrying briefcase, accompanies her towards the second Suburban.

opens.  Crockett and Isabella climb in.  The rear is customized cream leather, luxurious with three telephones a divider.  As Isabella climbs in, followed by Crockett, takes the briefcase from the Secretary and indicates he r in the front vehicle.  Doors close.  Windows go up.  Air conditioning comes on.  She raises the divider, blocking driver and locks the doors.  They are sealed in the back. Alone.  And she assaults Crockett with a passion that's desperate...as if making love to him puts her world back balance.  Their clothes come off, Crockett pauses...
Hola, chica.
Hola, viejo. He touches the side of her face.
Don't stop, bad man... As they continue, we...

at the bar.  It's jammed.  "Cochi Loco" Yero and his permanent bodyguard, El Tiburon, pass, smile.  Tubbs introduces Yero to Gina, as his wife. Yero shakes Gina's hand.  He indicates to the bartender t Tubbs and Gina are to pay for nothing...and he moves towa an office.  Cobalt blue light illuminates his face, and h fierce yellow eyes are not filled with hospitality.

location: FALS DE IGUAZU AIRPORT, (THREE BORDERS AREA)

text: deplaning his G-4 crosses to his armored Suburban.
climbs into the back.  It's also a traveling communicatio center, satellite uplink, encryption, the works...
(to an Assistant)
Do you have him? Assistant nods.  Montoya takes the heavy handset... MONTOYA (cont'd)
Jose, about the Americans...
(in Spanish)
They are "wrong."  I do not trust them.
(in Spanish)
Why?
(in Spanish)
Too good at what they do, I don't know.  Something I don't like. They are wrong... Montoya thinks.
(in Spanish)
Isabella likes them.  We made their deal. Montoya hangs up.  Jose Yero looks at the phone.
enter.  They join Tubbs and Gina.

sees Crockett's carriage with this woman.  It's different Intuitively, she exchanges a look with Tubbs.  Crockett m introductions.  Then, they move away to dance to a fast s in perfect synchronicity.  And, they're also SEEN by...

He watches them, too.  His yellow eyes are lit by strobes His eyes locked onto Isabella...dancing with Crockett, th bodies close... And in the way he looks at them, hurt, like a betrayed lo which he isn't and never could have been...we know now, t core of his antagonism.

It's a 30 year old, well-maintained carribean freighter w a steel table and u-shaped bench.  In the dark interior, narrow spots reveal the group hovering over a ruggedized Workpad with navigational software.
Transshipment point is here at 17:00 hours on the 23rd.
Uh-uh.  No predetermined places and times to meet.  Give me their heading and radio codes and I will talk to them directly with the longs and lats and time which will be a last minute deal...
You give yours to me.  We position all the assets hauling our loads...
Now how we do it, blood.  It risks signal interception and other bad things like people who don't need to know where we're at knowing. Tubbs hands Jose Yero's assistant, El Tiburon, a pager.

At ten to three on the 27th, I will satellite page him with a website and encryption code.  He will have ten minutes to log on and receive his new heading.  Ten minutes and thirty seconds, website disappears and he can drive his fucking boat up to Iceland... Jose Yero doesn't like it.
Malaysian registry.  Small containership. (to El Tiburon)
Give them their codes and heading. Everything Yero tells them feels to him like exposure.
Packaging?
Fifty-gallon drums.  Thirty-two.  A hundred kilos in each.  You transship that to the Malaysian boat.
Importation value?  At twenty-two thousand a ki...
You work that out with La Senora. (beat)
You will get sixteen fuel bladders of crystal meth precursors from the Malaysian ship.  For collection in North Miami.  You warehouse it. Release it when we say. (beat)
I'm sure you have friends with fast boats...
If you see a few new faces, don't get jumpy...
And Jose, my ace, lots of transshipment.  Lots of action. Skies are crowded.  And the JIT has assets on land, air, and sea. (beat)
So any intel you got that can come our way and contribute to the good and welfare...? Jose Yero's on the spot.
Sure.  Check your e-mail. Yero gets up and leaves the confined dining room.  He exi onto the walkway outside the bridge.  His path takes him past...
with Switek and Zito.  Trudy's in a tank top.  Jose looks Trudy appreciatively...
